intro: Eriospermum eriophorum, commonly known as the narrowleaf eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. It is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Eriospermum eriophorum is adapted to arid environments, with a deep root system that helps it survive in low-water conditions.
